DOC.brief_summary: Ischemic postconditioning can reduce myocardial injury following myocardial infarction. A potential pharmacological agent is the anesthetic Sevoflurane. The investigators' hypothesis is that sevoflurane during primary percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) will reduce infarct size.
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with first STEMI that will be treated by primary PCI, will be randomized to sedation with Sevoflurane during the procedure or to usual care.
DOC.criteria: First STEMI, presenting within 6 hours after the onset of chest pain Symptoms lasting > 30 minutes Persistent STsegment elevation > 0.1 mV in 2 or more contiguous leads Hypersensitivity to sevoflurane or other halogenated agents Malignant hyperthermia Cardiac arrest Cardiogenic shock Previous myocardial infarction or coronary bypass surgery Preinfarction angina Heart failure (NYHA III/IV) Chronic inflammatory disease Severe renal impairment Hepatic dysfunction Use of Glyburide
